U.S. Citizen Murdered by ICE on Jan 7

On January 7, 2026, a 37‑year-old U.S. citizen was fatally shot by an Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) officer in Minneapolis during a federal immigration enforcement action. Federal authorities have characterized the incident as self-defense, but local officials — including Mayor Jacob Frey — have condemned the killing as reckless and unnecessary, sparking protest and outrage in the Twin Cities and beyond.

News Coverage: ABC News: ICE-related shooting occurred in Minnesota, governor says
This article provides details on the incident, confirms the victim was a U.S. citizen, and includes video references of the event.
